snippet: The Ziegfeld Club, founded in 1936, helped women in theater who had fallen on hard times. The club is remaking itself with a new mission to support creative women on Broadway.
abstract: Ziegfeld Club, founded in 1936 by widow of theater impresario Florenz Ziegfeld Jr, has outlived last of former showgirls it was intended to benefit; executive director Laurie Sanderson hopes to revive organization with new mission of supporting creative work by women in musical theater.
lead_paragraph: The Ziegfeld Club, founded in 1936, helped women in theater who had fallen on hard times. The club is remaking itself with a new mission to support creative women on Broadway.

headline.main: Rediscovering the Ziegfeld Club and Its Showgirls
